title: Ticket #2941: condor_status should have -autoformat like condor_q does
description:
condor_q has a -autoformat option (added as part of #2656) that is easier to use than -format. it would be nice if condor_status had this feature as well.

the -autoformat option behaves like a series of -format commands with an implied first parameter of "%V" with a space between each field and a "\n" at the end of each record.

It is assumed that everything on the command line up to the next '-' part of the -autoformat command. Thus: 

condor_status -autoformat Name OpSys Arch -pool ....
results in the same output as: 
condor_status -format "%v" Name -format " %v" OpSys -format " %v\n" Arch -pool ....

-autoformat can be abbreviated -af, and can be followed by a : and optional formatting qualifiers.

  • t add a tab character before each field (instead of the default space)
  • n add a newline character after each field
  • , add a comma after each field
  • l label each field
  • V use %V rather than %v for formatting
  • h print headings before the first line output

the 'n' and ',' options are mutually exclusive.

-autoformat can be mixed with -format on the same command line, and -autoformat can be specified multiple times with different formatting qualifiers. The last specification of -autoformat will control the prefix (t), and suffix (n,) for the entire command. Thus 

condor_status -af:, Name -format "%.3f" LoadAvg -format "%.3f" TotalLoadAvg
will result in output like 
slot1@crane.cs.wisc.edu, 0.000, 0.250
slot2@crane.cs.wisc.edu, 0.000, 0.250
slot3@crane.cs.wisc.edu, 0.250, 0.250
slot4@crane.cs.wisc.edu, 0.000, 0.250
remarks:
2012-Aug-13 17:43:58 by sfiligoi:
Just saw this.

Why do we need -autoformat?

Doesn't 

-attributes
do exactly the same thing, conceptually?

2012-Aug-14 16:00:47 by johnkn:
sfiligoi: -attributes does not print out the values of the attributes, it merely controls which attributes are returned from a query.
